sentences.en: Even Samuel Butler often gets so quizzical.
sentences.cn: 甚至蒲脱勒(Samuel　Butler)有时也这么古怪.

sentences.en: He continued in a quizzical tone.
sentences.cn: 他以揶揄的声调继续说.

sentences.en: He gave me a quizzical look.
He gave Robin a mildly quizzical glance.
sentences.cn: 他有些惊讶地瞥了罗宾一眼。

sentences.en: He looked up with a quizzical look on his face.
sentences.cn: 他脸上带着困惑的神情抬头往上看.

sentences.en: His face wore a somewhat quizzical almost impertinent air.
sentences.cn: 她脸上出现了一种有些近乎无礼的嘲弄表情.

sentences.en: I gave him quizzical look. " Whom are you talking about? "
sentences.cn: 我神情古怪地看了他一眼: “ 你在说谁 啊 ? ”
乔里恩脸上显出尴尬和失望的样子.

sentences.en: LIZZIE: And the person with the quizzical brow?
sentences.cn: 丽齐: 那位长着古怪眉毛的 呢 ?

sentences.en: Many female voters reacted quizzical stares when asked whether gender was a factor in their decision.
sentences.cn: 许多女性选民被问到性别因素是否影响投票决定时,都露出狐疑的眼光.

sentences.en: Spruance and Pug Henry exchanged quizzical looks near the end.
sentences.cn: 快结束时,斯普鲁恩斯和帕格·亨利交换了一下探询的眼色.

words.tran_cn: 古怪的；引人发笑的；探询的；嘲弄的

trans.tran_en: If you give someone a quizzical look or smile, you look at them in a way that shows that you are surprised or amused by their behaviour
